cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then forecast to turn north-northeast across southwestern and central Louisiana toward the lower Mississippi Valley

weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Morgan City, LA, to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain, and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from High Island, TX, to the Mississippi coastline, with greatest impacts over south-central and southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 kt) likely Friday afternoon through early Saturday; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if the core shifts eastward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises 2–4 ft above ground possible along the Mississippi River delta, Lake Pontchartrain, and Lake Maurepas – capable of moving upriver toward port facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with locally higher amounts; significant flash and river flooding possible along the lower Mississippi River corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday–Friday night; dangerous seas and river currents impacting vessel traffic and terminal operations.
